image.altText: Man leans against fence, looks across farmland towards a peninsula in the distance.

props.synopsis: As Labor continues to target 82 per cent renewables by 2030, the amount of wind and solar in regional communities will continue to scale up. But balancing community and environmental interests has been challenging for companies and governments.

title.children: 'It split the town': Australia grappling with wind farms and social licence

image.altText: Fallow deer roaming in bush land.

props.synopsis: A project to rehabilitate wetlands in Tasmania has been going since the 80s. It keeps getting destroyed by deer — and the community group involved has had enough.

title.children: Decades of work lost to feral deer — and this group is sick of it

image.altText: 'Yes stadium' and 'No stadium' stickers composite image.

props.synopsis: A debate in which those in favour of and those against a proposed stadium in Hobart will have their say has likely given a good indication of whether the project will survive a vote in Tasmania's parliament.

title.children: 'A missed opportunity': Motion to renegotiate stadium deal voted down

image.altText: A man in a black suit and blue shirt posing for a photo sitting down.

props.synopsis: The author of an independent economic review of Hobart's proposed Macquarie Point stadium was encouraged by a senior Jacqui Lambie Network staffer to meet anti-stadium activists before he was formally appointed to conduct the review.

title.children: Anti-stadium activist meetings with report author disclosed weeks later

image.altText: A man in a yellow t-shirt with an Aboriginal flag on it.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian Aboriginal elder who says he does not recognise "colonial courts" has come into a courtroom to directly address a magistrate, resulting in an argument between the two men.

title.children: 'It doesn't make any difference to me': Magistrate and Aboriginal elder argue in court

image.altText: Aerial view of a stadium.

props.synopsis: "You pack 'em up in a box. They come out in a box." Senator Jacqui Lambie thinks she's found a "best of both worlds" solution to Tasmania's stadium dilemma.

title.children: Jacqui Lambie floats 'tent-like' roof fix for AFL stadium row

image.altText: A young mother sitting on a couch with a smiling toddler lying across her lap

props.synopsis: New research shows educational disadvantage begins when children are as young as two if they can't access childcare. With about one quarter of the country living in "childcare deserts", experts are demanding more from both parties.

title.children: 'That trajectory is set': Research finds educational disadvantage begins at two

image.altText: Untitled Photo - 2025-04-10 12:52:34

props.synopsis: Energy Minister Chris Bowen and his Coalition counterpart Ted O'Brien go head-to-head in a debate at the National Press Club. Follow live.

title.children: 'More detail in a Chinese menu': Energy ministers clash in first debate

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: O'Brien leaves the door open to Coalition leaving Paris Agreement
Coalition won't make decision on emissions targets before election
Bowen sticks with 2030 emissions reduction targets

image.altText: A worker checks cable connection on a solar panel at a solar farm

props.synopsis: While experts weigh in on the great energy debate, one builder says the industry has already made up its mind.

title.children: In the debate between renewables and nuclear, some say it's 'game over'

image.altText: Lady standing in front of media

props.synopsis: Housing Minister Clare O'Neil is seeking to keep approving development projects ahead of the election regardless of the government being in caretaker mode, but the Coalition has heavily criticised the request.

title.children: Labor wants to break election rules to approve housing applications

image.altText: A dark-haired woman and bearded man hold a curly-haired toddler outside a house.

props.synopsis: Victoria allows people under investigation for abuse and assault to retain their working with children clearance. Parents and advocates say it is high time that changed.

title.children: Child protection failures horrify parents of boy smacked at daycare

image.altText: A woman wearing a red t shirt and black glasses stands across the road from Westfield Bondi Junction

props.synopsis: Survivors say they are still breaking down and deeply traumatised by the stabbing attack on April 13, 2024 at Westfield Bondi Junction that killed six people.

title.children: 'I still have nightmares': The high price paid by Bondi stabbing witnesses

image.altText: Julie Bishop wearing a red dress, speaking on stage while sitting

props.synopsis: Julie Bishop has made her first visit to military-ruled Myanmar since her UN appointment last year, meeting with the foreign minister as the nation recovers from an earthquake that killed more than 3,600 people.

title.children: UN special envoy Julie Bishop makes first trip to Myanmar after earthquake

image.altText: jim angus

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers and his opposition counterpart Angus Taylor clash in an evenly matched TV debate over the budget, productivity, Donald Trump's trade war and their personal weaknesses.

title.children: Chalmers warns of Coalition 'ambush' on spending as Taylor slams lack of crisis 'buffers'

image.altText: Workers dismantle a tent

props.synopsis: Homeless woman Carol Ross says council workers gave her one hour to remove her personal belongings from her tent before they loaded it onto the back of a garbage truck.

title.children: Rough sleepers' tents binned as council outlaws homeless camping

image.altText: A digital mock up of a brown building, with a deck amongst an outback Australian greenery scene.

props.synopsis: It was the dream of two former Australians of the Year. Now, a world-class, Aboriginal-led tertiary education precinct is on the cusp of being brought to life in north-east Arnhem Land.

title.children: First look at 'visionary' Aboriginal-led tertiary education precinct

image.altText: GettyImages-2209395005

props.synopsis: The kids of some of golf's biggest names put on a show as their dads try to avoid winning 'jinxed' Par 3 competition.

title.children: Crowd goes wild as champ's kid holes long putt, as golfers avoid winning 'jinxed' competition

image.altText: Outback flooding in South Australia's far north.

props.synopsis: While communities around Adelaide cope with drought, another part of South Australia is dealing with a "historic" flood event. Here's what we know.

title.children: Flooding has created an 'inland tsunami' in remote South Australia

image.altText: GettyImages-2208733123

props.synopsis: Serbian legend Novak Djokovic bemoans a 'horrible' performance in Monte Carlo as two Australians moved through the tournament.

title.children: 'It was horrible': Djokovic rolled in Monte Carlo as Aussies win through

image.altText: Brunette haired woman with bandage over missing nose

props.synopsis: Prosthetics funding is a key election issue for face and neck cancer survivors whose prostheses are not currently covered by Medicare.

title.children: Unequal prosthetic rules leave cancer survivor unable to afford new nose

image.altText: An eagle on the ground with its wing dragging on the ground.

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating the deaths of seven juvenile wedge-tailed eagles found shot on a rural property in southern New South Wales.

title.children: Seven wedge-tailed eagles found dead or injured on NSW property

image.altText: helicopter in the sky

props.synopsis: An industry expert says the aviation watchdog should have identified the faulty radio that contributed to a fatal mid-air helicopter crash at Sea World on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Sea World choppers 'shouldn't have operated' at time of tragedy, expert says

image.altText: Close up on soldier wearing gas mask in greenish atmosphere.

props.synopsis: Pop culture might mock doomsday preppers, but in some cases, their mindset can teach us helpful lessons.

title.children: Beyond 'bunker mentality': How preppers are planning for the next crisis

image.altText: Pilbara residents

props.synopsis: As the national debate over the future of Woodside's North West Shelf gas plant heats up, opinions among the people living and working next to it are mixed.

title.children: This WA gas project is a big election issue, but what do locals think?

image.altText: A man speaking. In this picture, only his face is visible.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he has intelligence indicating 155 Chinese citizens are fighting for Russia on his country's soil.

title.children: Zelenskyy says 155 Chinese nationals fighting with Russia in Ukraine

image.altText: King Charles in a black tuxedo looking to the side alongside Queen Camilla smiling in a turquoise gown

props.synopsis: King Charles and Queen Camilla have met Pope Frances privately at the Vatican's Casa Santa Marta, where the pontiff has offered his best wishes for their 20th wedding anniversary.

title.children: King Charles and Camilla make surprise visit to Pope Francis

image.altText: A still-standing Buddha statue appears to survey the debris beneath and surrounding him after the earthquake in Myanmar.

props.synopsis: The deadly Myanmar earthquake last week was the biggest among a number of smaller quakes that rocked the region.

title.children: A spate of earthquakes just rattled the Asia Pacific. Should we worry?

image.altText: A large white box with LM on it, on top of a large green circuit board.

props.synopsis: Two new studies suggest optical computing will address "bottlenecks in traditional computing" and reduce energy demands driven by advances in AI.

title.children: Is using light to crunch data the next big thing in computing?

image.altText: Prince Harry exits a Rolls Royce outside the High Court in London in June 2023 and waves to the media

props.synopsis: The prince has been fighting a court battle to restore his British police protection to what it was before his split from the royal family.

title.children: Prince Harry's 'life at stake' by UK protection removal, court hears

image.altText: A drone shot of a forestry pine plantation.

props.synopsis: Severe and prolonged drought conditions in one of Australia's largest forestry regions are killing pine trees, and raising concerns about the future of the country's building material supplies.

title.children: Fears for major forestry region as pines trees die from drought stress

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou holds his arms outstretched

props.synopsis: Ange Postecoglou's tenure with Tottenham will be on the line in their Europa League quarterfinal clash with Eintrach Frankfurt, but the embattled manager is vowing to fight on despite "glass-half-empty rhetoric".

title.children: Postecoglou lashes out at negativity as Spurs tenure goes on the line

image.altText: A woman wearing a sports uniform jacket points towards the stadium seats behind her.

props.synopsis: While the Matildas are still looking for their long-term head coach, assistant Melissa Andreatta signs on to coach Scotland's national women's team.

title.children: As Matildas coach search goes on, Scotland poaches top assistant

image.altText: A young Aboriginal woman and man stand smiling in front of a large screen playing an animation, set up in the desert.

props.synopsis: The 10th annual Indigenous arts and culture festival in Alice Springs feels urgent as Australia gears up for the first federal election since the failed Voice to Parliament referendum.

title.children: In remote Australia stereotypes run rampant. But this festival is a 'balm'
